IRR decision rule. Analyzing an investment (project) using the IRR method provides
the analyst with a result in terms of a rate of return.
The following are decision rules of IRR analysis:
• Accept projects with an IRR that is greater than the firm's (investor's) required rate
of return.
• Reject projects with an IRR that is less than the firm's (investor's) required rate of
return.
Note that for a single project, the IRR and NPV rules lead to exactly the same accept/
reject decision. If the IRR is greater than the required rate of return, the NPV is positive,
and if the IRR is less than the required rate of return, the NPV is negative.
